DOC.HEADLINE: LIGHT RAIN TO DIMINISH BY MID-MORNING
DOC.TEXT: A storm front moving_in from Central California is expected to bring light to moderate rainfall to Orange County this morning , weather_forecasters said . Rain should begin countywide around dawn but taper_off by mid-morning , said meteorologists with WeatherData Inc. However , showers may continue through mid-afternoon in isolated areas in the county , they said . The storm should drop between . 10 of an inch and . 50 of an inch of rain across the county . " It doesn ' t look_like that much precipitation , " Curtis Brack of WeatherData said . By tonight , skies should be clear and low_temperatures in the 40s , Brack said .
